events.t: Sun's birthday;
The death of Anthony Fokker, the founder of Fokker Company
Martyrdom of Imam Ali al-Naqi al-Hadi (peace be upon him) - Birthday of Ahmad Mahmoud, a contemporary Iranian writer - Death of Iranian playwright Akbar Radi
Christmas celebration - the birthday of Isaac Newton, the English physicist and mathematician - the death of Charlie Chaplin, the actor, director and composer, winner of the Oscar - Friendship Day

Friday - Bam earthquake [1382] - Martyrdom anniversary of Ashu Zoroaster, the great man of history - Martyrdom anniversary of Ashu Zoroaster, the great man of history - Death of Iranian playwright Akbar Radi - Anniversary of Karbala operation 4 [1365]
Birthday of Johannes Kepler, famous German scientist, mathematician and astronomer
Zadrooz Forough Farrokhzad, the Iranian poet, passed away Susan Sontag, writer, literary theorist and political activist from America

Day of Azar, the second day of Digan - the birthday of the Iranian poet Forough Farrokhzad - the death of the Swiss poet Carl Spittler, winner of the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1919 - the birthday of Ronald Coase, the British economist and writer, the winner of the Nobel Prize in Economics in 1991 - the day of commemoration of Yaqub Leith Safari (Radman Pourmahek), the first Iranian king after Islam - the day of commemoration of Yaqub Leith Safari (Radman Pourmahek), the first Iranian king after Islam

Death of French writer Romain Rolland, winner of the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1915 - Birthday of French painter Francis-Andre Vincent - Execution of Azeri patriots in Tabriz by the Russian occupying forces [1290 AD] - Execution of Azeri patriots in Tabriz by the Russian occupying forces [1290 AD]

Birth of Imam Muhammad Taqi (peace be upon him) - Death of French economist and mathematician Gerard Debrou, winner of the 1983 Nobel Prize in Economics - Birth of Iranian sculptor Lilith Trian, the mother of Iranian sculpture.
New Year celebration
Friday - Hafez day

The birth of Imam Ali (peace be upon him) and Father's Day - the death of Nima Yoshij, the father of new Persian poetry - the martyrdom of Sardar Haj Qasim Soleimani [1398] - the birthday of John Ronald Roel Tolkien, the British writer and linguist, the creator of works such as The Hobbit and Lord of the Rings - the death of Jack Robbie, the assassin of Lee Harvey (the assassin of John F. Kennedy, the president of the United States of America)
Louis Braille's birthday, the inventor of Braille

Day of Mehr Roz, the third festival of Digan - Death of Hazrat Zainab, peace be upon her - Birthday of Shah Jahan, the fifth emperor of the Gurkan dynasty of India - Martyrdom of Mansour Sattari, one of the commanders of the Air Force of the Islamic Republic of Iran

The birthday of Gibran Khalil Gibran, the famous American writer of Lebanese origin, the creator of the famous work of the Prophet - the death of Louis Braille, the inventor of Braille - the sinking of the Sanchi ship [1396]

The execution of Babak Khormedin by the hand of Mutassim, the Abbasid caliph in Samarra - the death of Nikola Tesla, the inventor of the radio, physicist and engineer of Serbian American origin - the incident in which 56 Shiites were killed in Kerman
British physicist and cosmologist Stephen Hawking's birthday - the death of famous Italian scientist and inventor Galileo Galilei - Ukrainian Airlines Flight 752 shot down [2018 solar]

Friday - the birthday of French feminist philosopher and writer Simone de Beauvoir - the death of American economist James McGill Buchanan, winner of the Nobel Prize in Economics in 1986 - the death of Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani [1395]
The murder of Amir Kabir by the order of Naser al-Din Shah Qajar [1230 AD] - Death of Gabriela Mistral Chilean poet, teacher, diplomat and feminist, winner of the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1945
American physicist Carl David Anderson, winner of the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1936, passed away
Zadroz Jack London American writer - Zadroz Mohsen Hashtroudi Iranian mathematician, philosopher and poet.
The birthday of Albert Schweitzer, a German physician and musician, winner of the Nobel Peace Prize in 1952 - the death of Edmund Halley, an English astronomer, physicist and meteorologist
Martyrdom of Imam Musa Kazem (peace be upon him) - The British Museum in London was opened to the public, today this museum preserves more than 7 million pieces of cultural works of different eras.
Friday - the death of Arturo Toscanini, Italian composer, musician and conductor.
Mission of Rasool Akram (pbuh) - Implementation of JCPOA agreement

Birthday of Yoichiro Nambu, Japanese-American physicist, winner of the Nobel Prize in Physics in 2008 - Death of Rudyard Kipling, writer and novelist from England of Indian origin, winner of the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1907
For the first time, the incandescent light bulb made by Thomas Edison started working in New Jersey.
